result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
9:30 AM Defendant Joseph N. Carlson in court.  Attorney John K Smerlinski in court for Joseph N. Carlson.  Attorney Laura Kohl in court for State of Wisconsin. Detective Curtis Erdman sworn in under oath to testify. Detective Erdman identifies the defendant. Cross. Detective Erdman excused from stand. Arguments. ADA Kohl requests The Court find probable cause and bind the matter over for trial. Atty Smerlinski has no argument. Court finds probable cause. Defendant bound over for trial. Information filed.  Court advises defendant of charges & penalties. Information follows the criminal complaint. DE waived formal reading and stands mute. The Clerk is to enter a plea of not guilty on the defendants behalf. Matter set over.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 3, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on January 3, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 12, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant waives time limits for preliminary hearing. Defendant referred to apply with Judge's office for Court Appointed Attorney following this hearing. Bond continues. Matter set over.
